oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-10-05 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 5, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Jim Reeves (host/performer), guest performers Bill Carlisle and the Carlisles, and regular performers Pete Stamper (his first appearance), Rufus Thibodeaux, the Jordanaires, Chet Atkins, June Carter, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 939th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jim Reeves; Pete Stamper; Bill Carlisle; Carlisles; Rufus Thibodeaux; Jordanaires; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Harvey's commercial -- Grant Turner introduces Jim Reeves -- Yonder Comes A Sucker (Jim Reeves) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Jim Reeves) -- Jim Reeves introduces Pete Stamper -- Comedy routine (Pete Stamper) -- Jim Reeves introduces Bill Carlisle -- Uncle Bud (Bill Carlisle and the Carlisles) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Jim Reeves) -- Jim Reeves introduces Rufus Thibodeaux -- Boil Them Cabbage Down (Rufus Thibodeaux fiddle) -- Jim Reeves talks -- Peace In The Valley (Jim Reeves, Jordanaires) -- Jim Reeves introduces Chet Atkins -- Hidden Charm (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Stamper, Pete, 1930-; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jordanaires (Musical group); Thibodeaux, Rufus, 1934-; Reeves, Jim; Carlisle, Bill; Carlisles (Musical group)
